channel.title: Bogan Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Bogan Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: RAH Cart Volunteers Needed by PTG
item.description:
The PTG is seeking RAH Cart volunteers to help distribute RAH Cart Prizes once a month on Friday mornings. Interested volunteers should email the PTG at BoganPTG@gmail.com to get involved.

View original newsletter

item.title: Food Resources Available for Families
item.description:
Due to uncertainty about SNAP benefits in November, Talawanda is sharing food resource options: - Little Free Pantry - Located outside main entrance at Bogan, restocked daily - Backpack Program - Small bag of food for students every Thursday - Family Food Boxes - Can be picked up or delivered within 24 hours - Community Pantries - Additional resources linked in the flyer

For help accessing these resources, contact Emily White, Bogan Social Worker at 513-273-3403 or whitee@talawanda.org

View original newsletter

item.title: Lost and Found Reminder Before Winter Break
item.description:
The lost and found is filling up with lunchboxes and clothing items. Students who have misplaced items should check the lost and found soon. Any unclaimed items will be donated after winter break. Parents are reminded to label their child's belongings with their name to help return lost items.

item.title: Lost and Found - Claim by Winter Break
item.description:
The lost and found is filling up with lunchboxes and clothing items. Students should check for their missing items soon - anything unclaimed by winter break will be donated. Parents are asked to label their child's belongings with their name to help return lost items.

item.title: Kiwanis Holiday Food Drive for TOPSS
item.description:
Bogan K-Kids is collecting donations for the Kiwanis Holiday Food Drive to benefit families served by TOPSS (Talawanda Oxford Pantry and Social Services). Donations can be brought to Bogan October 27th-November 7th.

Requested items include: - Canned Green Beans - Cream of Mushroom Soup - Cream of Chicken Soup - Baking Mixes - Mac & Cheese - Crispy Onions - Hygiene Products (Shampoo, Soap, Toothpaste, Deodorant, etc.)

Contact Ms. Currier or Mrs. Bryan with questions.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Cafeteria Lunch Accounts and November Menus
item.description:
Lunch account reminders: Add funds through PaySchool Central. Accounts that reach -$50 will be rolled into school fees, so please keep accounts current.

November menus are now available for breakfast and lunch. The breakfast menu includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Bowls, Chocolate Donut Holes, Sausage & Cheese Biscuit Sandwiches, and more throughout the month. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk are included with every breakfast. The cafeteria is closed November 24-25 and 27-28 for Thanksgiving break.

View original newsletter

item.title: Talawanda Spirit Wear Grand Opening Sale
item.description:
The PTG has launched a new Talawanda spirit wear collection in addition to Bogan Spirit Wear! The Grand Opening Sale runs until October 21, 2025 with 25% off using code SPIRIT303. Available items include t-shirts, hoodies, polos, headwear, backpacks, drinkware, and more. Free shipping on orders over $75. Shop at 1stplace.sale/115858.

item.title: Lunch Account Reminders and October Menu
item.description:
Parents can add funds to student lunch accounts through PaySchool Central. Accounts that reach -$50 will be rolled into school fees, so please keep accounts current. The October lunch menu is now available, featuring themed weeks including National Apple Day (October 21), Halloween items, and daily options with sides like fresh cucumber slices, celery sticks with ranch, and various fruits and vegetables.

View original newsletter

item.title: 5th Grade CogAt Testing Schedule
item.description:
5th graders will take the CogAt test on October 27th, 28th, and 29th. Testing begins at 10:30am (after specials). Students should arrive on time and be ready to test. More information about the CogAt test.

item.title: PUSH Home Repair Grants for Low-Income Homeowners
item.description:
PUSH (Preserving and Updating Shelters for Homeowners) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit www.push-oxford.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: When to Stay Home from School
item.description:
Cold and flu season guidelines for keeping sick children home have been updated. Stay home if your child has: a fever of 100°F or higher, frequent/continual coughing or difficulty breathing, diarrhea or vomiting, body rash with fever, active head lice, eye infection with discharge, or sore throat with congestion. Return to school when: fever-free for 24 hours without medication, symptoms are improving, and specific condition requirements are met (e.g., 24 hours after starting antibiotic eye drops, tolerating food for 12 hours after vomiting). If your child is absent, call the attendance line and submit any doctor's notes to the front office. For COVID-19, students can return when fever-free for 24 hours without medication and symptoms are minimal and improving.

View original newsletter

item.title: 2025-2026 Yearbook Sales Now Open
item.description:
Yearbook sales for the 2025-2026 school year have started early!

Order deadline: March 25th

Yearbook ID Code: 8480626

Order online at ybpay.lifetouch.com or scan the QR code on the flyer to purchase your yearbook and capture a year of memories.

item.title: Join PTG Remind for Updates
item.description:
Stay connected with the Bogan PTG by joining their Remind group for quick updates, event reminders, and volunteer opportunities sent directly to your phone. This service provides short, timely texts so you don't have to search through emails.

Join here: https://www.remind.com/join/boganpt?utm_medium=android

A QR code is also available for easy sign-up.

View original newsletter

item.title: Tech Healthy Household Parent Presentation
item.description:
Project Reboot + Talawanda School District presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. This engaging 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A, hosted by Dino Ambrosi (Founder of Project Reboot), will cover: - Tech Addiction: Why it happens and how to overcome it - How to Discuss Screen Time: Conversations with kids without eye rolling - Practical Tips: Maintaining balanced relationships with technology

All attendees receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. Event supported by Greater Oxford Community Foundation. More info: https://projectreboot.school

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
The Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly will be held on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd., Oxford, Ohio 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM and the assembly at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. The event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS. To RSVP, scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch of service, and total number attending.

item.title: Dessert Sign-Up for Teacher Conferences
item.description:
The PTG needs a few more desserts for Thursday night's teacher conferences. Volunteers can sign up to contribute desserts to show appreciation for teachers. Sign up here

The image displays three strawberry-themed desserts: layered parfaits in glasses, a fruit tart with strawberries and blueberries, and a slice of cake with berries, promoting the conference dessert event.

item.title: 3rd Grade State Testing Information
item.description:
3rd grade students will take the Ohio State Test for English Language Arts on Tuesday, October 21st and Thursday, October 23rd, beginning at 9:30am. Parents are encouraged to write letters of encouragement for their child to read before testing (please place in an envelope). A pep rally is scheduled for Monday, October 20th, and students who do their best will be invited to a Movie Party on Friday, October 24th. Parents should talk with students about trying their best, taking their time, and checking their work.

5 Tips for Testing Success (from image): - Get plenty of rest - Be on time - Eat a good breakfast - Relax & take a deep breath - Follow your teacher's directions

3rd Grade Testing Pep Rally

item.title: Halloween Celebration at Bogan Elementary
item.description:
Halloween will be celebrated on Friday, October 31st with costumes permitted under specific guidelines: no masks, props, or excessive makeup, and costumes must be worn to school all day. A costume parade will take place at 9:30am outside (weather permitting) or in the gym if raining, and parents are welcome to attend. Many classrooms will also host Halloween parties—check with your child's teacher for specific plans. Contact your child's teacher if you prefer they not participate.

Halloween Celebration at Bogan

item.title: ADHD Research Study for 5th Graders
item.description:
Cincinnati Children's RISE (Resilience In Student Education) is conducting a research study for 5th grade students with ADHD or attention/hyperactivity challenges. Caregivers and students can earn up to $320 for completing questionnaires about academics, organization skills, and social-emotional well-being.

To participate: - Complete the interest form: https://redcap.link/RISEstudy - Email: RISEstudy@cchmc.org - Call: 513-803-6321 - Visit: studentresilience.org

View original newsletter
